title.narrative: Cooperation agreement with European Centre for Development Policy Management

description.narrative: Objective: The European Centre for Development Policy Management (ECDPM) is an independent ‘think and do tank’ working on international cooperation and development policy in Europe and Africa. ECDPM has 70 staff members from over 25 countries worldwide who provide research, advice and practical support to policymakers, advisors and practitioners in Europe, Africa and beyond – in order to make policies work for sustainable and inclusive global development. The main areas of work include EU external affairs, peace and security, African institutions, migration, food security, economic transformation and economic diplomacy. The grant will support the main objective of ECDPM, which is to link policy and practice in European development and international cooperation and produce high quality and independent research. Furthermore ECDPM will keep DMFA informed of relevant developments within EU’s external action and development with a particular focus on the future of EU-Africa/African Union, EU-ACP Post Cotonou relations, the multi-annual financial framework (MFF) 2021-2027, security and resilience, migration (including EU’s External Investment Plan), economic and agricultural transformation, private sector development, trade and economic partnership agreements (EPAs), reform of African institutions, the European Investment Bank’s economic resilience initiative and Policy Coherence for Sustainable Development.
